intro: Napellus vulgaris, commonly known as the common napellus, is a flowering plant native to temperate regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs such as carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, clustered white or greenish flowers. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland areas or along stream banks. The plant is noted for its subtle fragrance and is occasionally used in traditional herbal remedies.
